name: C3: Crash Consistency Checker
body:
## Are your program crash-safe?

C3 automatically checks a software for potential data loss.

## Using C3

To use C3, you just need to provide a manuscript - how to do the initial setup and how to run the program. The rest is as easy as clicking a button. There are samples in the `subjects` directory.

1. (Do this only once is sufficent) If you have not started c3disk driver yet, you may start it by, which should be run as root:

        > ./init

2. Place your inital file-system snapshot and test recepie (manuscript.py) in a sub-directory (e.g., gzip). Then validate by (also requires root)

        > ./validate gzip

    It will generate a report for you.

The program contains kernel-parts, we suggest users try it in a virtual machine to avoid potential bugs.

## Dependencies:

1. Kernel: The c3disk driver requires a recent kernel (tested on 4.2). If you are using 3.x, there will be slight modification to the code. 
2. C libraries: libssl-dev (available in repository)
3. Python libraries: pyautogui (depends on xlib, pil and tk)
